meanings.definition: A complete list of items, typically organized in a systematic way.
meanings.sent1: I keep a catalogue of all my toys in a special book.
meanings.sent2: The library has a catalogue of all the books available for borrowing.
meanings.sent3: My brother made a catalogue of all the snacks in the house, it was quite funny.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a catalogue, neatly organizing thoughts into categories.
meanings.sent5: The catalogue of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To make a systematic list of items.
meanings.sent1: I will catalogue all the books on the shelf for easy reference.
meanings.sent2: She decided to catalogue her stamp collection to keep track of each one.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to catalogue all the ingredients in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: His memory carefully catalogued every detail of that special day.
meanings.sent5: The detective's mind began to catalogue the clues in an orderly fashion.

meanings.definition: A publication containing detailed information about a program or event.
meanings.sent1: I picked up a catalogue of upcoming concerts at the music store.
meanings.sent2: The school sent out a catalogue of courses available for the semester.
meanings.sent3: The catalogue for the magic show had a surprising twist at the end.
meanings.sent4: Her notebook served as a catalogue of all the exciting events in town.
meanings.sent5: The catalogue for the art exhibition was beautifully designed.
